Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGOBE; PAINTED
Name: Vase
Description: Fragments of pottery corresponding to a bowl with a wide mouth, pointed rim and thin curved walls. Paste of an orangey colour and interior and exterior surface of a yellowish colour. There is a painted decoration on the rim, consisting of a black line. On the body we see a fish silhouetted in black with interior details in red. Below the rim runs a horizontal groove.
